effect.text: Look at up to 5 cards from the top of your deck and rearrange them as you like.

tips: Best used immediately before draw effects to maximize value
Stack Energy on top if you need to power up Pokemon over several turns
Put key Trainer cards on top when you need specific answers
Consider future draws - arrange for multiple good turns, not just the next one
Most valuable in late game when deck is thin and specific cards are critical
In most decks, cards that actually draw are superior to Pokedex

rulings.ruling: You can look at up to 5 cards from the top of your deck (you may choose to look at fewer)
After looking at the cards, rearrange them in any order you choose
The cards remain on top of your deck - they are not drawn or discarded
Your opponent does not see which cards you looked at or how you arranged them
If your deck has fewer than 5 cards, you can only look at and arrange the remaining cards
You must keep the same cards on top - you cannot shuffle your deck after using Pokedex
If your opponent uses an effect that shuffles their deck after your Pokedex, your arrangement is lost
You can use Pokedex even if your deck has only 1 card remaining
